intro: Trichanthecium wettsteinii, commonly known as the Wettstein's trichanthecium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually small and yellow, arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Trichanthecium wettsteinii is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along rocky outcrops.
